newsitem.title: CANADA: Gandalf drops after filing for protection.
newsitem.headline: Gandalf drops after filing for protection.

text.p: Shares in Gandalf Technologies Inc lost about half their value at the opening in Toronto on Monday after resuming trading following news on Friday the company filed for creditor protection.
The computer equipment maker tumbled 0.49 to 0.49 in brisk trading of more than 400,000 shares.
Money-losing Gandalf, based outside of Ottawa, said it would restructure and perhaps find a buyer.
"There's no fundamental reason why any investor would want to own this stock," said one Gandalf watcher who declined to be identified.
He added that only vulture funds would be interested in speculating on the company's future.

Analysts have said that Gandalf might be acquired at its current value of about C$20 million, excluding debt, or that rivals would only be interested in snapping up equipment or parts of the business.
